p: Inactivation at positive potentials of Na + and K + channels has been ascribed to a positively charged ball at the N-terminus blocking the internal channel mouth (bal at a chain), which leads to an inward-rectifying steady-state IV relationship (cf., e. g. also Sect. 10.1007/978-3-319-30012-2_5). A similar interpretation has been suggested for the PTX -modified Na +,K + pump. Indeed, the truncated mutant does not show inactivation anymore (Fig. 8.3b), while application of the truncated N-terminal peptide restores inactivation (Fig. 8.3c).
